citation.article-title: Proposal of Corynebacterium propinquum sp. nov. for Corynebacterium group ANF-3 strains

p.s: Description of Corynebacterium propinquum sp. nov.
Corynebacterium. propinquum (pro'. pin. qu. um L. adj. propinquus near, close)
Bacteria are nonmotile pleomorphic rods, nonspore forming, Gram-positive with occasionally metachromatic granules and arranged in palisades or V-shaped forms.
They are non-acid fast, and no rod-coccus cycle is present.
They are catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
They are facultatively anaerobic.
Colonies (1 to 2 mm in diameter) on 5% sheep blood agar are nonhemolytic, grey-white with a matted surface.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Acid is not produced from o-glucose, glycogen, lactose, sucrose, ribose, o-xylose, D-mannose, D-galactose, trehalose, and o-mannitol or on triple sugar iron agar.
Tyrosine is degraded but not gelatin, starch and urea.
Esculin is not hydrolyzed.
The methyl red test is negative and acetoin is not produced.
Growth is visible in 6.5% NaCl.
Hydrolysis of hippurate is variable.
Production of pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase is variable, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are not produced.
Cells utilize acetate, lactate, glyconate and malate.
Utilization of adipate and phenyl acetate is variable.
Propionate, glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, N-acetyl glucosamine, maltose, caprate and citrate are not utilized.
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid, arabinose and galactose.
The predominant types of mycolic acids are C30:1, C30:2, C32:1, C32:2, C34:1, C34:2 and C36:2.
The DNA base composition is 57 to 59 mol% G + C (HPLC). C. propinquum strains were isolated from human sources, mainly respiratory tract.
The type strain is B 77159 (= Collection of the Institut Pasteur CIP 103792).
It was isolated by a tracheal aspiration of a patient.
This strain has all of the above properties for the species.
Adipate is utilized but not phenyl acetate.
Pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase and alkaline phosphatase are not produced.
The mol% G + C content of DNA is 57.
